intro: Gonolobus iyanolensis, commonly known as the Iyanolé bush, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in parts of Cuba and the Bahamas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy habitats, showing some degree of salt tolerance. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain seeds. Despite its ecological significance, it is not widely cultivated or studied compared to other members of its family.
